attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government was due to issue Phase 2 European Union Allowances (EUAs) to all UK installations on 28th February 2008. However, it has failed to do so. 
 
This failure is hindering growth in the carbon market and having a direct and negative impact on UK industry. Despite a promise to issue allowances within weeks of its announcement, there is still no sign of activity from DEFRA. 
 
Failure to issue the EUAs directly contradicts guidance from the European Commission indicating that member states can and should issue their EUAs. 
 
Allowances have a time value and failure to deliver the 2 billion allowances – with a value of roughly €48 million – are being borne by UK industry; a sector already struggling with high energy prices and faltering economic conditions. 
 
We urge the Government to issue the allowances now.
